basic.floral_language:
Haworthia truncata
Floriography: unique, classical, lucky
Has dark green, fleshy and juicy leaves closely layered side by side forming a fan-shape. There are nearly transparent marks at the upper end of the leaves, has high ornamental values. 
Likes sunshine, has a short dormant period in summer, place under bright scattered light. Flowers sometimes in white color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, white flowers

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes moderate light and resistant to half shade, dormant in summer under high temperatures, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
